headline: Apollo Global, Workday to Join S&P 500. Here’s Who Didn’t Make It.
summary: Apollo Global Management  and  Workday  will be added to the  prior to the start of trading on Dec. 23 in conjunction with the index’s quarterly rebalancing.  The two companies will replace  Qorvo  and  Amentum Holdings  which will move to the  index, according to a press release from S&P Dow Jones Indices.  There was considerable speculation before the announcement at 5:15 ET whether S&P Dow Jones Indices would add any companies to the S&P 500 in conjunction with the rebalancing and, if so, which would join.

headline: Robinhood gains retail crypto mkt share from Coinbase
summary: Investing.com -- Robinhood Markets (NASDAQ:HOOD) is gaining market share in retail cryptocurrency trading from rival Coinbase (NASDAQ:COIN) amid the Bitcoin rally to $100,000, which has driven trading volumes across platforms, Mizuho (NYSE:MFG) said in a note.

headline: Trump Plans to Appoint Musk Confidant David Sacks as AI, Crypto Czar
summary: President-elect  Donald Trump  named a Silicon Valley investor close to  Elon Musk  as the White House’s artificial intelligence and cryptocurrency policy chief, signaling the growing influence of tech leaders and loyalists in the new administration.  David Sacks,  a longtime venture capitalist who worked with Musk at  PayPal  more than two decades ago, will serve as the “White House A.I. & Crypto Czar,” Trump said on his social-media platform Truth Social.
